DataElement.preferredName: Self-Report Hospitalization Patient Discharge Disposition Location Description Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location where the patient returned after being discharged from the hospital.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The release of a patient from a course of care._The textual representation of the physical location of the subject or entity._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

Concepts.definition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An in-patient medical facility equipped with a trained nursing staff that provides a wide range of health and personal care services, with a focus on medical care. These services typically include nursing care, 24-hour supervision, three meals a day, and assistance with everyday activities.

Concepts.definition: A specialized, short-term care facility, that offers care (often including rehab) for a previously hospitalized patient as they transition back to their home or maybe eventually a nursing home.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person's permanent place of residence.

Concepts.definition: A person's permanent place of residence.
